page.title: 12Rothbury Music Festival
page.content: In July we have a traditional music festival which lasts for three days. Musicians travel to Rothbury from all over the United Kingdom and there are competitions for adults and schoolchildren. You can hear the Scottish bagpipes and the Northumbrian pipes and listen to buskers who wander around the streets. There are also mummers plays and people reading dialect poems. You can see different kinds of folk dancing, including sword dancing. Children from our school and the first school take part in competitions and win prizes. on the Saturday of the festival there are competitions in our school and the first school which is on the other side of the village. Over the weekend there are many strangers around.
